```{r, echo=F, warning=F}
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

include_graphics("TIDAL.png")
```

# TIDAL Data Exploration

For more information, see the [TIDAL GitHub page](https://github.com/AmeliaES/TIDAL)

Date generated: `r Sys.Date()`

## Descriptive Statistics

Descriptive statistics of the variable "`r params$phenotype`" for each time point in your data.

```{r, echo=F, warning=F}

kbl(params$descTable, digits = 3) %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = "hold_position")

```

time_point: Time point of data collection. N: Number of measurements (e.g. people) at each time point. mean: Mean `r params$phenotype`. SD: standard deviation of `r params$phenotype`. median: Median of `r params$phenotype`. IQR: Interquartile range of `r params$phenotype`

## Model Results

`r params$modelType` model was run using [lme4](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/index.html) with `r params$formCode`.

`r strsplit(params$warningMsg, " Please")[[1]][1]` For more information on lme4 optimisers, see [here](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/vignettes/lmerperf.html). The use of alternative lme4 optimisers is currently not supported.

### Number of observations and groups

`r params$statement`

`r params$N`

## Plot

```{r, echo = F}
params$mainPlot
```

`r params$modelType` `r params$formCode`. "Phenotype" on the y-axis is `r params$phenotype`. Note that any categorical covariates/confounders are set to level zero.

### Fixed Effects

Fixed effects can be interpreted as the effects of time/age (and any additional covariates/confounders) on `r params$phenotype`.

```{r, echo=F}
kbl(params$fixedTab[,3:ncol(params$fixedTab)], digits = 3)  %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = "hold_position")
```

### Random Effects

Random effects can be interpreted as the effects on `r params$phenotype` due to variation between subjects.

```{r, echo=F}
kbl(params$randomTab, digits = 3)  %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = "hold_position")
```

```{r, echo = F}
params$datExAltPlot
```

```{r, echo=F}
kbl(params$datExAltTable, digits = 3)  %>%

```
